The American women seem to have a natural talent for making various useful ar- ticles. They can mould pots and jugs of various forms of clay, not With the assistance of a turn- ing machine, like potters‚ but With their hands alone. These clay vessels they bake‚ not in an oven, but out of doors, placing sticks round them. They cannot glaze them with lead, but they first dye them of a red colour, and then rub them with a kind of glue to make them shine. There is never any snow, and very little frost, in the region inhabited by the Abi— pones: but when the South wind blows hard, the air becomes very pierofflg, and sometimes intolerably so to persons thinly clad. The Abipones shield themselves from the cold With a cloak made of otters' skins.
